name: Stacy's Greek-Inspired Tuna Salad
author: Stacy Scott-Calcagni
summary: Another twist on a new creation for tuna salad. I don't like olives, so there are none in my recipe, but other ingredients bring the Greek flavors to this tuna! Makes a generous portion for 2, or it can be divided up to make 3 or 4 smaller portions. Enjoy! Serve with pita chips if you like.
ingredients: 2 (5 ounce) cans solid white albacore tuna in water, drained
½ cup seedless red grapes, halved
¼ cup tzatziki sauce, or more to taste
¼ cup slivered or sliced almonds, toasted
salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 cups spring mix greens, or as desired
directions: Place tuna in a medium bowl
Add cucumber, grapes, tzatziki sauce, almonds, feta cheese, dill, salt, and pepper
Add lemon juice and mix again
Serve on a bed of greens with pita chips on the side
